summary: This bill, the "Mitigating Extreme Lawlessness and Threats Act," amends title 18 of the United States Code to increase penalties for rioting. It specifies harsher punishments based on the severity of the rioting, including imprisonment for up to ten years, and for acts of violence related to rioting, potentially up to life imprisonment. The bill also specifies that if the defendant assaults a federal law enforcement officer or member of the uniformed service, the defendant shall receive a harsher sentence.
